subject: RE: [junit] testing private methods
msgSnippet: ... Take a look at JUnitX. I think that you can do this via the TestProxy (which uses reflection to get to the private methods/fields).
messageBody:
Nilesh Thali wrote:

> Hi,
> Don't want to start any religious wars, but just curious:
> Why wouldn't we want to maybe have an option to test all methods of a
> class,
> even the ones which are private ?

Take a look at JUnitX. I think that you can do this via the TestProxy (which
uses reflection to get to the private methods/fields).
